pullRequest.title: Centralise padding for new ui pages
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 the [contributor license agreement][] is signed
 commit message follows [commit guidelines][]
 tests are included
 screenshots are included showing significant UI changes
 documentation is changed or added

Description of change


Centralise CSS padding for the main content area of New UI so that each page does not need to duplicate styles.


Refactor Login notice editor and Theme page so that they have consistent padding as other pages.

commit.message: Centralise CSS padding of New UI main content area in 'template.tsx'
Remove redundant margin for Theme page.

Move the content of Pre/Post login notice editor from 'SettingsMenuContainer'
to a MUI Card.

Remove SettingsMenuContainer.

Remove CSS styles used for MUI Cards in Search setting related pages.

In the Setting page template, use MUI Grid to render child components
and the Save button.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -164,22 +165,21 @@ class PostLoginNoticeConfigurator extends React.Component<
               onChange={(e) => this.handlePostTextFieldChange(e.target)}
               value={postNotice}
             />
-          </Grid>
-          <Grid item container spacing={8} direction="row-reverse">
-            <Grid item>
-              <Button
-                id="postClearButton"
-                disabled={dbPostNotice == ""}
-                onClick={this.stageClear}
-                variant="text"
-              >
-                {commonString.action.clear}
-              </Button>
-            </Grid>
-          </Grid>
-        </Grid>
+          </CardContent>
+
+          <CardActions>
+            <Button
+              id="postClearButton"
+              disabled={dbPostNotice == ""}

commit.message: Add type checks for MUI Sliders used in Content indexing page.

Fix linting format issues.

Co-authored-by: Christian Murphy <christian.murphy.42@gmail.com>
